definition: to exchange/to change (clothes etc)/to substitute/to switch/to convert (currency)

sentences.english: Only in the dark will ring inadvertently substituted.
sentences.chinese: 只是在不经意间暗将年轮偷换。

sentences.english: The original blade in early before they tick off pistol in last bullet.
sentences.chinese: 原来刀锋早在之前便偷换掉手枪里最后一颗子弹。

sentences.english: The thief interchanged the diamonds with some pieces of glass.
sentences.chinese: 那个窃贼将钻石用一些碎玻璃偷换了。

sentences.english: Will the funds be spent on ballet lessons for his daughter or on a stolen vacation?
sentences.chinese: 是把钱用在女儿的芭蕾舞课程，抑或用于周末的偷换？

definition: lit. to steal a rafter and replace it with a column/to replace the original with a fake/to perpetrate a fraud (idiom)
to steal sb's valuable item and substitute a similar-looking but worthless item/to sell a fake for the genuine article/to palm off
to obscure/to confuse/to mix up/to blur/to mislead
to obscure the facts (idiom); to mislead the public with prevarication and deliberate falsehoods
to pass off fish eyes for pearls/to pass off fake products as genuine (idiom)
lit. to put Zhang's hat on Li's head/to attribute sth to the wrong person (idiom)/to confuse one thing with another
lit. the plum tree withers in place of the peach tree/to substitute one thing for another/to carry the can for sb

to make use of/to use sth as pretext/under false pretenses/under the guise of/masquerading as/lenient/tolerant/loan character (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/character acquiring meanings by phonetic association/also called phonetic loan
lit. to hang a sheep's head while selling dog meat (idiom)/fig. to cheat/dishonest advertising/wicked deeds carried out under banner of virtue
pinyin: gua4 yang2 tou2 mai4 gou3 rou4

definition: lit. to graft flowers onto a tree/to surreptitiously substitute one thing for another (idiom)
lit. new wine in old bottles; fig. new concepts in an old framework/(loan idiom from Matthew 9:17, but fig. meaning is opposite)
